text: Erigeron lanuginosus is a Chinese species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows on alpine slopes at high elevations in Tibet. Erigeron lanuginosus is a perennial, clump-forming herb up to 25 cm (10 inches) tall, forming a branching, woody rhizome. Its flower heads have bright purple ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron lanuginosus Y. L. Chen, 1981. 棉毛飞蓬 mian mao fei peng ==References== lanuginosus Category:Flora of Tibet Category:Plants described in 1981
title: Erigeron lanuginosus
